Package ohos.media.extractor

Class Extractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.extractor.Extractor

  • public class Extractor
extends Object
    Separates audio from video data in multimedia files and extracts audio and video data sources.

    This class is used together with other classes to implement different functions. Example scenarios:

    1. Working with the Muxer class: The Extractor class separates multimedia audio and video sources, and the Muxer class combines the data sources into a new media file.

    2. Working with the Codec class: The Extractor class separates multimedia audio and video data sources, and the Codec class decodes

    the audio and video data in the data sources, and encodes the decoded data into the required output format.

    Example code: 

    
 Source source = new Source(...);
 Extractor extractor = new Extractor();
 extractor.setSource(source);
 int trackCount = extractor.getTotalStreams();
 for (int i = 0; i < trackCount, i++) {
     extractor.specifyStream(i);
     Format format = extractor.getStreamFormat();
 }
 ByteBuffer byteBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(size);
 while(extractor.readBuffer(byteBuffer, 0) > 0) {
     extractor.getFrameTimestamp();
     extractor.getFrameType();
     extractor.next();
 }
 extractor.release();
    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Multimedia#MEDIA

      • setSource

        public boolean setSource​(Source source)
        Sets the media playback source.

        This method must be called prior to other methods of the Extractor class.

        Parameters:
        source - Indicates the source of the media to demultiplex.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the setting is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        1

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • unspecifyStream

        public boolean unspecifyStream​(int id)
        Deselects a track.

        To reselect a track that has been selected, you must first deselect it.

        Parameters:
        id - Indicates a track ID.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the track is deselected; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter is invalid.
        Since:
        1

      • rewindTo

        public boolean rewindTo​(long microseconds,
                        int mode)
        Rewinds to a specified frame based on the time and mode.

        This method can be called before, during, and after a media file is played.

        Parameters:
        microseconds - Indicates the time point, in microseconds. It is a non-negative number.
        mode - Indicates the rewinding mode.
        • REWIND_TO_PREVIOUS_SYNC - Rewinds to the previous frame.
        • REWIND_TO_CLOSEST_SYNC - Rewinds to the closest frame, which can either be the previous or next one.
        • REWIND_TO_NEXT_SYNC - Rewinds to the next frame.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the rewinding operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • next

        public boolean next​()
        Rewinds to the next frame.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the rewinding operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • readBuffer

        public int readBuffer​(ByteBuffer buf,
                      int offset)
        Reads demultiplexed data.

        Before calling this method, you must call specifyStream() to select a track.

        Parameters:
        buf - Indicates the buffer from which data is read.
        offset - Indicates the start position of the data in the buffer, which is a non-negative number.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the data if obtained; returns -1 if no data has been read.
        Since:
        1

        public long getFrameTimestamp​()
        Obtains the time point of a data source, in milliseconds.
        Returns:

      • getFrameSize

        public long getFrameSize​()
        Obtains the size of a data source, in bytes.
        Returns:
        Returns the size of the data source if obtained; returns -1 if no data is available.
        Since:
        1

      • getFrameType

        public int getFrameType​()
        Obtains the type of a data source.
        Returns:
        Returns the flags if obtained; returns 0 if an exception occurs.

        type: SAMPLE_FLAG_SYNC - Indicates that a key frame is read from the buffer.

        SAMPLE_FLAG_ENCRYPTED - Indicates that an encrypted frame is read from the buffer.

        SAMPLE_FLAG_PARTIAL_FRAME - Indicates that an incomplete frame is read from the buffer.

        Since:
        1

        Releases resources.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the resources are released; returns false otherwise.
        Since:

      • finalize

        protected void finalize​()
                 throws Throwable
        Description copied from class: Object
        Called by the garbage collector on an object when garbage collection determines that there are no more references to the object. A subclass overrides the finalize method to dispose of system resources or to perform other cleanup.

        The general contract of finalize is that it is invoked if and when the Java™ virtual machine has determined that there is no longer any means by which this object can be accessed by any thread that has not yet died, except as a result of an action taken by the finalization of some other object or class which is ready to be finalized. The finalize method may take any action, including making this object available again to other threads; the usual purpose of finalize, however, is to perform cleanup actions before the object is irrevocably discarded. For example, the finalize method for an object that represents an input/output connection might perform explicit I/O transactions to break the connection before the object is permanently discarded.

        The finalize method of class Object performs no special action; it simply returns normally. Subclasses of Object may override this definition.

        The Java programming language does not guarantee which thread will invoke the finalize method for any given object. It is guaranteed, however, that the thread that invokes finalize will not be holding any user-visible synchronization locks when finalize is invoked. If an uncaught exception is thrown by the finalize method, the exception is ignored and finalization of that object terminates.

        After the finalize method has been invoked for an object, no further action is taken until the Java virtual machine has again determined that there is no longer any means by which this object can be accessed by any thread that has not yet died, including possible actions by other objects or classes which are ready to be finalized, at which point the object may be discarded.

        The finalize method is never invoked more than once by a Java virtual machine for any given object.

        Any exception thrown by the finalize method causes the finalization of this object to be halted, but is otherwise ignored.

        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
        Throws:
        Throwable - the Exception raised by this method
        See Also:
        WeakReference, PhantomReference
